title: Broken MIR generated by offset_of! on struct with lifetime

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust #![feature(offset_of)] use core::mem::offset_of; struct Foo<'a> { bar: &'a (), } const BAR_OFFSET: usize = offset_of!(Foo<'static>, bar); ``` ### Meta ``` rustc 1.71.0-nightly (ce5919fce 2023-05-15) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued error: internal compiler error: broken MIR in Item(DefId(0:7 ~ playground[346c]::BAR_OFFSET)) (after phase change to runtime-optimized) at bb0[0]: Free regions in optimized runtime-optimized MIR --> src/lib.rs:8:27 | 8 | const BAR_OFFSET: usize = offset_of!(Foo<'static>, bar); | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | ```
